{{cpp/title|difftime}}
{{cpp/chrono/c/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=ctime|
double difftime( std::time_t time_end, std::time_t time_beg );
}}

Computes difference between two calendar times as {{lc|std::time_t}} objects ({{c|time_end - time_beg}}) in seconds. If {{c|time_end}} refers to time point before {{c|time_beg}} then the result is negative.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|time_beg, time_end|times to compare}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Difference between two times in seconds.

===Notes===
On POSIX systems, {{lc|std::time_t}} is measured in seconds, and {{tt|difftime}} is equivalent to arithmetic subtraction, but C and C++ allow fractional units for {{tt|time_t}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;ctime&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::time_t start = std::time(nullptr);
    volatile double d = 1.0;

    // some time-consuming operation
    for (int p = 0; p &lt; 10000; ++p)
        for (int q = 0; q &lt; 100000; ++q)
            d = d + p * d * q + d;

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Wall time passed: "
              &lt;&lt; std::difftime(std::time(nullptr), start) &lt;&lt; " s.\n";
}
|p=true
|output=
Wall time passed: 9 s.
}}
